content: out the back of the hat 2 measure 1 5 2 2 5 3 across the top of the hat from the corner this point and the point that you previously measured will form a diagonal line when the yarn is completely woven through for now use this new point as a guide for where you will be finishing up weaving the scrap yarn either leave the ruler lying next to the hat or mark it if you need to 3 take the needle and insert it from the back up through a spot about 1/3 of the way between the two measured points 3 © lizzy knits llc 2017 4 insert the needle from the front to the back another 1/3 of the way between the measured points it should start to look like a diagonal line following a straight path between the two points 5 lastly insert the needle from the back to the front at the ending point along the top edge 6 tie off one of the ends and weave the end inside the hat 7 thread the other end through the tapestry needle and pull the yarn as tight or as loose as desired i tend to pull the yarn a lot tighter on the adult sizes for a more scrunched ear i hardly pull the yarn tight at all on the baby/newborn sizes just enough to show a little ear definition experiment with what you would prefer 8 when the ear is as scrunched as you d like it tie off the end and weave it inside the hat repeat this process for the other ear and try to make it the same amount of scrunched as the first ear so they match the photos may provide a simpler explanation both pictures show what the front of the hat should look like before and after **copyright 2017 erin gates no part of this pattern or
